reviews.snippet:
Great atmosphere, great food, great service. In fact, probably among the best out of the same type of restaurant (halal wagyu serving) I've ever been too.

The staff here can converse both in English and Japanese so you don't have to be scared of ordering if you think your 日本語 is not jozou yet.

I tried their limited time "yakiniku ramen set". It's really good and super filling. My only regret is that my flight back home is coming soon, and it's gonna be a long time until I can experience their food again. 🥲

There's also a prayer room provided so you can have your meals and prayer break too.

Would definitely recommend everyone to stop by and experience the food and service here. Also big thanks to the people at Halal Wagyu Ramen Shinjuku Tei for making it easier for people to access halal food in Japan. Here's to more halal/kosher/vegetarian/vegan-friendly restaurants opening up!

reviews.snippet:
Visited them yesterday on our last night in Ikebukuro! Absolutely incredible experience! The food was fantastic — rich, flavorful ramen with perfectly marbled halal wagyu that just melts in your mouth.

The spicy red broth was a flavor bomb, and the wagyu sushi (2 pcs is not enough! We end up ordering 6 pcs 🤭) and crispy karaage were next-level good. Shoutout to the 'Beef Man'! Superb chef!

The customer service was just as amazing — friendly, fast, and very welcoming.  Everything is halal and thoughtfully prepared, including a prayer space, which is a huge plus.

If you’re in Tokyo and love ramen or wagyu, this place is a must-visit. Can’t wait to come back!

extracted_snippet.original:
